title: Design and Effect Analysis of Distance Learning for [Large-Scale] Nursing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment combining in-person and remote instruction. Requires real-time lecture participation and project execution via personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners propose ≥3 strategies for acquiring nursing theory (basic/adult nursing) and practical skills (vital sign measurement, injection techniques) in remote education and design scenarios achieving ≥80% satisfaction in peer and instructor feedback.

Using nursing simulation tools (e.g., vSim® for Nursing, Shadow Health), learners analyze three key limitations of remote education (lack of practice opportunities, delayed feedback, limited patient interaction) and submit designs with ≥2 compensatory strategies per limitation.

Learners analyze survey data (≥100 samples) on remote education readiness (5 indicators) and learning effectiveness (3 indicators) using SPSS or Excel, and write 5–7-page reports including ≥2 data visualizations, key findings, and improvement recommendations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
